config.text: What should you do before you tow a trailer for the first time?

choices.label: Ask DVLA to update your licence
Fit P plates to your trailer

correct.text: You need to know how to tow a trailer safely. This includes hitching the trailer to your vehicle, checking the trailer for defects, reversing with a trailer and how to deal with any problems. There are accredited trainers who can teach you these skills. Professional training will also give you confidence in your ability to tow a trailer safely.

incorrect.text: You need to know how to tow a trailer safely. This includes hitching the trailer to your vehicle, checking the trailer for defects, reversing with a trailer and how to deal with any problems. There are accredited trainers who can teach you these skills. Professional training will also give you confidence in your ability to tow a trailer safely.

config.text: What should you do if your trailer starts to swerve or snake?

correct.text: If your trailer starts to swerve or snake, reduce speed gently to regain control. Do not accelerate or brake harshly.

incorrect.text: If your trailer starts to swerve or snake, reduce speed gently to regain control. Do not accelerate or brake harshly.

config.text: Are passengers allowed to ride in a caravan that's being towed?

choices.label: Only if all the seats in the towing vehicle are full
Only if a stabiliser is fitted

correct.text: Riding in a towed caravan is highly dangerous. The safety of the entire unit is dependent on the stability of the trailer. Moving passengers would make the caravan unstable and could cause loss of control.

incorrect.text: Riding in a towed caravan is highly dangerous. The safety of the entire unit is dependent on the stability of the trailer. Moving passengers would make the caravan unstable and could cause loss of control.

config.text: What safety device must be fitted to a trailer braking system?

correct.text: In the event that the trailer becomes detached from the towing vehicle, the breakaway cable activates the trailer brakes before snapping. This allows the towing vehicle to get free of the trailer and out of danger.

incorrect.text: In the event that the trailer becomes detached from the towing vehicle, the breakaway cable activates the trailer brakes before snapping. This allows the towing vehicle to get free of the trailer and out of danger.

config.text: You're planning to tow a caravan. What will help the handling of the combination?

choices.label: A jockey wheel fitted to the tow bar
Power steering fitted to the towing vehicle
Anti-lock brakes fitted to the towing vehicle
A stabiliser fitted to the tow bar

correct.text: Towing a caravan or trailer affects the way the towing vehicle handles. A stabiliser device isn't designed to overcome instability caused by incorrect loading but it can give added security in side winds and from buffeting caused by large vehicles.

incorrect.text: Towing a caravan or trailer affects the way the towing vehicle handles. A stabiliser device isn't designed to overcome instability caused by incorrect loading but it can give added security in side winds and from buffeting caused by large vehicles.

config.text: What would be affected if you carry a very heavy load on your vehicle?

correct.text: Any load will have an effect on the handling of your vehicle, and this becomes worse as you increase the load. You need to be aware of this when carrying passengers or heavy loads, fitting a roof rack or towing a trailer.

incorrect.text: Any load will have an effect on the handling of your vehicle, and this becomes worse as you increase the load. You need to be aware of this when carrying passengers or heavy loads, fitting a roof rack or towing a trailer.

config.text: How will a heavy load on your roof rack affect your vehicle's handling?

choices.label: It will improve the road holding
It will reduce the stopping distance
It will make the steering lighter

correct.text: A heavy load on your roof rack will reduce the stability of the vehicle because it moves the centre of gravity away from that designed by the manufacturer. Be aware of this when you drive round bends and corners. If you change direction at speed, your vehicle and/or load could become unstable and you could lose control.

incorrect.text: A heavy load on your roof rack will reduce the stability of the vehicle because it moves the centre of gravity away from that designed by the manufacturer. Be aware of this when you drive round bends and corners. If you change direction at speed, your vehicle and/or load could become unstable and you could lose control.

config.text: How should you load your trailer?

choices.label: Put heavy items at the front
Put heavy items at the back
Put heavy items over the axle(s)
Put heavy items in the corners

correct.text: When loading your trailer, you should spread the weight evenly with heavy items over the axle(s). This should reduce the risk of it swerving or snaking.

incorrect.text: When loading your trailer, you should spread the weight evenly with heavy items over the axle(s). This should reduce the risk of it swerving or snaking.

config.text: You're carrying a child under three years old in your car. Which restraint is suitable for a child of this age?

correct.text: It’s your responsibility to ensure that all children in your car are secure. Suitable restraints include a child seat, baby seat, booster seat or booster cushion. It’s essential that any restraint used is suitable for the child’s size and weight, and fitted according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

incorrect.text: It’s your responsibility to ensure that all children in your car are secure. Suitable restraints include a child seat, baby seat, booster seat or booster cushion. It’s essential that any restraint used is suitable for the child’s size and weight, and fitted according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

config.text: How should a load be carried on your roof rack?

choices.label: Loaded towards the rear of the vehicle

correct.text: Any load must be securely fastened to the vehicle. The safest way to carry items on the roof is in a specially designed roof box. This will help to keep your luggage secure and dry, and it also has less wind resistance than loads carried exposed on a roof rack.

incorrect.text: Any load must be securely fastened to the vehicle. The safest way to carry items on the roof is in a specially designed roof box. This will help to keep your luggage secure and dry, and it also has less wind resistance than loads carried exposed on a roof rack.

config.text: What should you do if you're towing a trailer and it starts to swing from side to side?

choices.label: Ease off the accelerator to reduce your speed
Let go of the steering wheel and let it correct itself
Brake hard and hold the pedal down

correct.text: Strong winds or buffeting from large vehicles can cause a trailer or caravan to swing from side to side ('snake'). If this happens, ease off the accelerator. Don’t brake harshly, steer sharply or increase your speed.

incorrect.text: Strong winds or buffeting from large vehicles can cause a trailer or caravan to swing from side to side ('snake'). If this happens, ease off the accelerator. Don’t brake harshly, steer sharply or increase your speed.

config.text: What restrictions apply if you're towing a trailer on a three-lane motorway?

choices.label: You must have a stabiliser fitted
You must not use the right-hand lane

correct.text:
The motorway regulations for towing a trailer state that you must not
  • use the right-hand lane of a three-lane motorway unless directed to do so (for example, at roadworks or due to a lane closure)
  • exceed 60 mph.

incorrect.text:
The motorway regulations for towing a trailer state that you must not
  • use the right-hand lane of a three-lane motorway unless directed to do so (for example, at roadworks or due to a lane closure)
  • exceed 60 mph.

config.text: What does it mean if your trailer has a maximum authorised mass (MAM) of 3,500 kg?

choices.label: Your trailer can carry a load of 3,500 kg
Your trailer and towing vehicle combined cannot weigh more than 3,500 kg
Your trailer and load combined cannot weigh more than 3,500 kg

correct.text: The MAM of the trailer is stamped on the plate fitted to the chassis. It is the maximum weight of the trailer and load that the manufacturer has designed it to carry. Do not load your trailer so that it exceeds this maximum weight.

incorrect.text: The MAM of the trailer is stamped on the plate fitted to the chassis. It is the maximum weight of the trailer and load that the manufacturer has designed it to carry. Do not load your trailer so that it exceeds this maximum weight.

config.text: When would you increase the pressure in your tyres so that it's above the normal value?

choices.label: When the vehicle is fitted with anti-lock brakes
When the tyre tread is worn below 2 mm

correct.text: Check the vehicle handbook. This should give you guidance on the correct tyre pressures for your vehicle and when you may need to adjust them. If you’re carrying a heavy load, you may need to adjust the headlights as well. Most cars have a switch on the dashboard to do this.

incorrect.text: Check the vehicle handbook. This should give you guidance on the correct tyre pressures for your vehicle and when you may need to adjust them. If you’re carrying a heavy load, you may need to adjust the headlights as well. Most cars have a switch on the dashboard to do this.

config.text: Who's responsible for making sure that a vehicle isn't overloaded?

choices.label: The owner of the items being carried
The person who loaded the vehicle

correct.text: Carrying heavy loads will affect control and the vehicle's handling characteristics. If the vehicle you're driving is overloaded, you'll be held responsible.

incorrect.text: Carrying heavy loads will affect control and the vehicle's handling characteristics. If the vehicle you're driving is overloaded, you'll be held responsible.

config.text: What's the minimum depth of tread on the tyres of a trailer?

correct.text: Your car or small van must have a minimum tread depth of 1.6 mm across the centre of the tread and around the entire circumference. This also applies to the tyres on your trailer.

incorrect.text: Your car or small van must have a minimum tread depth of 1.6 mm across the centre of the tread and around the entire circumference. This also applies to the tyres on your trailer.

config.text: You've just passed your driving test. What's the maximum authorised mass (MAM) of any trailer that you can tow?

correct.text:
When you pass your driving test, you're allowed to tow a trailer up to 3,500 kg MAM without taking an extra test.
If you want to tow a heavier trailer, you'll have to pass either a CE or DE category test, dependent on the towing vehicle.

incorrect.text:
When you pass your driving test, you're allowed to tow a trailer up to 3,500 kg MAM without taking an extra test.
If you want to tow a heavier trailer, you'll have to pass either a CE or DE category test, dependent on the towing vehicle.

config.text: What must you do when you hitch an unbraked trailer to a towing vehicle?

choices.label: Grease the tow ball and hitch
Switch off the reversing sensor on the towing vehicle
Make sure you can see the trailer in the mirrors

correct.text: If a tow hitch fails, the trailer must stay connected to the towing vehicle. This is achieved by using a secondary coupling device, such as a safety chain.

incorrect.text: If a tow hitch fails, the trailer must stay connected to the towing vehicle. This is achieved by using a secondary coupling device, such as a safety chain.

config.text: You wish to tow a trailer. Where would you find the maximum noseweight for your vehicle’s tow hitch?

correct.text: You must know how to load your trailer or caravan so that the hitch exerts an appropriate downward force on the tow ball. Information about the maximum permitted noseweight can be found in your vehicle handbook or obtained from your vehicle manufacturer’s agent.

incorrect.text: You must know how to load your trailer or caravan so that the hitch exerts an appropriate downward force on the tow ball. Information about the maximum permitted noseweight can be found in your vehicle handbook or obtained from your vehicle manufacturer’s agent.

config.text: You're going to tow a trailer that's wider than your car. What must you fit to your car before you start towing it?

correct.text:
You must fit exterior towing mirrors to your vehicle if
  • your vehicle is narrower than your trailer or load
  • your trailer or load obstructs the view behind you.

incorrect.text:
You must fit exterior towing mirrors to your vehicle if
  • your vehicle is narrower than your trailer or load
  • your trailer or load obstructs the view behind you.

config.text: You're about to start a journey towing a trailer. What should you do if you notice that a light on your trailer is not working?

choices.label: Continue with your journey because the lights on your car are working
Disconnect the trailer electrical coupling before continuing with your journey
Repair the fault before continuing with your journey
Book the trailer in for repair before continuing with your journey

correct.text:
You must make sure that your vehicle and trailer are roadworthy. Check that your tyres are legal, and the brakes and lights are working properly.
If any of these things are not working, you must not drive or tow your trailer until the fault is repaired.

incorrect.text:
You must make sure that your vehicle and trailer are roadworthy. Check that your tyres are legal, and the brakes and lights are working properly.
If any of these things are not working, you must not drive or tow your trailer until the fault is repaired.
